attributes.action: encourage TfL to reverse the huge daily capping rate increases it has imposed on 16-17 year old Oyster card users.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
In 2006, the daily capping rate for a 16-17 year old was £2, regardless of the number of zones used. TfL changed this in 2007 to be as high as £3.10, depending on which zones you travel in. This means for a 16-17 year old living in zones 5 or 6, the daily capping rate has increased by an astonishing 55%.

Meanwhile, the capping rate for an under 16 travelling in the same zones has not changed, and for an adult has increased from £5.80 to £6.20 - a change of only 7%.

This is a huge increase in fares, especially when compared with the fare increase for others. This increase is being imposed on people who do not generally have a lot of money, perhaps living only off their EMA allowance. Over 60s, meanwhile, who generally have more money than 16-17 year olds, travel for free in London.
